A lot of twists and deaths. I feel like: The Last Jedi is a very underwhelming and incongruous addition to the Star Wars series. The Marvel-esque \"that's gotta hurt\" quipping that followed every epic moment/explosion diffused so much of the drama and felt cheap\, lazy and completely out of place. The portrayal of Luke seemed mishandled\, tarnished with the aforementioned wisecracking - a far cry from his character in previous films. A trip to a casino planet was horribly designed and realised\, more like Star Trek than Star Wars  - complete with an unfunny CGI skit involving an anonymous gnome and BB8. Killing off Snoke was a baffling decision and ruined all of his ominous build up in The Force Awakens. Fans of the film will say this is a \"brave\" departure with \"new\" ideas - for me\, it simply made The Last Jedi feel more like a Marvel film and less special. Very disappointed and I hope that Disney see this as a misstep in retrospect.
